OK, then it takes a c=
entralized global registry to allow / enforce a shared
semantic.  Which is =
not necessary REST related problem at all and is often
futile, when there i=
s no incentive from the participating players.

Besides, I doubt registerin=
g new specific media types is universally
practiced by REST services develo=
pers. Otherwise, IANA registry would have
been sufficient, and no need for =
catalogues as
http://www.programmableweb.com/ or http://www.biocatalogue.or=
g/ .

make the second service use the same shared understanding of<br>

 processing media type / link-reltypes, if he is free to invent its<br>
&gt=
; own?<br>
<br></div>
Regarding the media-type: REST states that media-type=
s should be registered with a central authority (IANA, Enterprise, what eve=
r). When registering new media-types the authority checks for duplicates - =
or sets up a procedure for avoiding them. This is REST's way of reducin=
g the problem (I don't believe it goes away completely - but the proble=
m becomes smaller).<br>

<br>
Some link-reltypes are document together with=
 the media type (as Mike points out, link-reltypes can exist outside any me=
dia-type - see <a href=3D"http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/li=
nk-relations.xml" target=3D"_blank">http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-re=
lations/link-relations.xml</a>).<br>

<br>
So when the client originally se=
nt the Accept-header with application/vnd.imageprocessor+xml) it told the s=
erver to return a representation that contains link-reltypes documented in =
the media-type spec. Other link-reltypes are of course allowed, but may be =
ignored by the client.<br>

<br>
So, again, the media-type becomes the turn=
ing point.<br></div></div></div></div></blockquote><div><br></div><div><br>=
</div><div>OK, then it takes a centralized global registry to allow / enfor=
ce a shared semantic. =C2=A0Which is not necessary REST related problem at =
all and is often futile, when there is no incentive from the participating =
players.</div>
<div><br></div><div>Besides, I doubt registering new specifi=
